title: Write spec: error-handling.md (J8)
description:
Write the v2 error-handling spec at specs/error-handling.md following the JTBD template in specs/README.md.

Job: J8 — Handle Errors and Build Resilience. Detect, report, and recover from failures — AI CLI crashes, network issues, invalid configs — with configurable failure threshold and graceful degradation.

v2 scope (from README): Structured error handling with configurable failure threshold and <promise> output signals.

No v1 archive equivalent — v1 had no error handling (known issue documented in archive specs). This is entirely new for v2.

Key aspects to specify: AI CLI exit status handling (v1 ignores it), <promise>SUCCESS</promise> and <promise>FAILURE</promise> output signal detection (FAILURE means agent is blocked and cannot make further progress, not a single test failure), iteration outcome matrix (exit code x output signal), configurable consecutive failure threshold (loop.failure_threshold, default 3), timeout mechanism for AI CLI invocation, config validation errors, network failure handling, graceful degradation (what happens when a component fails but the loop can continue).

Note: Quality gates (test failures, lint failures) are the AI agent's responsibility driven by prompts, not the loop's concern. The loop only knows about AI CLI exit codes and promise signals. Retry logic with backoff may be relevant for transient AI CLI failures but should be weighed against the fresh-context-per-iteration design (each iteration is inherently a retry).

v1 known issues to address: 'No error handling for AI CLI failures' and 'No timeout' from archive/specs/ai-cli-integration.md and archive/specs/iteration-loop.md.

Template sections: Job to be Done, Activities, Acceptance Criteria, Data Structures, Algorithm, Edge Cases, Dependencies, Implementation Mapping, Examples, Notes.

Cross-references: iteration-loop.md (J1 — iteration outcome matrix, failure threshold), ai-cli-integration.md (J3), observability.md (J9).
